report_title: Industry Report on Gym and Exercise Equipment Manufacturing
executive_summary: Globalization trends have negatively influenced domestic gym and exercise equipment manufacturing, as foreign manufacturers produce gym and exercise equipment at far lower costs. Nonetheless, innovative gym and exercise equipment has attracted consumers to US-made products and mitigated some import penetration. Revenue declined in 2020 because of gym closures following the outbreak of COVID-19. Individuals purchasing gym and exercise equipment for home workouts offset some losses in the commercial market.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Outbreak of COVID-19 Had Mixed Effects
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The outbreak of COVID-19 led to plummeting demand from the commercial market as gyms and hotels looked to reduce large expenditures and additional costs during lockdowns and economic uncertainty. Home and individual users became attracted to gym and exercise equipment as they began doing home workouts since gyms were closed, offsetting some losses in the commercial market in 2020.

To decrease production and labor costs, many US gym and exercise equipment manufacturers have moved their operations to Asia over the current period. In July 2022, Peloton announced it will no longer manufacture its products through Tonic Fitness Technology, a Taiwan-based company Peloton acquired. Peloton will look to Rexon Industrial Corp. to manufacture its products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Steady Downstream Demand Will Benefit Manufacturers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Key consumer groups, like individuals younger than 30 and aging baby boomers, will drive demand, who comprise the largest user markets of sports and exercise equipment. Fueled by a rise in available leisure time as they approach retirement, baby boomers will increasingly turn to sports and recreational activities to stay fit and prolong their life expectancy.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The trend of individuals working out at home will continue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The trend of individuals working out at home, which has sharply risen during the pandemic, will continue over the outlook period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profit to Inch Up as Operating Conditions Become More Favorable
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Stability in input costs like steel and aluminum will be a boon to gym and exercise manufacturers' profit through the outlook period. Falling import penetration, as the value of the US dollar drops, from low-cost foreign manufacturers will benefit profit by reducing some cost-based competition. To compete with lower-quality imports, many gym and exercise equipment manufacturers have shifted their focus to trendier or more technologically advanced equipment, which yields higher profit.

Import penetration from low-cost foreign manufacturers will fall through the outlook period as domestic consumers look to higher-quality products made in the US. Exports will return to growth, fueled by a rising number of global gym memberships and international consumers' attraction to high-quality, technologically advanced fitness equipment from the US. As low-cost manufacturers continue to absorb most of the domestic demand, US manufacturers will continue targeting foreign buyers.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry manufacture gym and exercise machines, including treadmills, exercise bikes, weights and other equipment for both home and fitness centers. Following the design of sample products, manufacturers purchase raw materials and transform these into a range of athletic equipment. The finished products are then marketed to wholesalers, retailers and individual consumers.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - steady

opportunities: Demand from gym, health and fitness clubs

key_trends: Import penetration hindered gym and exercise equipment manufacturers. Low-cost foreign-made products have attracted consumers in recent years, hampering revenue and profit.
Growth will accelerate over the outlook period
Manufacturers must comply with general manufacturing regulations
The versatility of exercise equipment is becoming increasingly important
Home and individual users increasingly purchased gym and exercise equipment
California is a boon to the West
The Southeast's large population attracts manufacturers
Price is the primary source of competition
Manufacturers compete based on their products' quality and features
One company has amassed more than 5.0% of the market
Many companies are beginning to manufacture overseas

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market comprises individuals purchasing customized home fitness equipment.
This market comprises locations that provide exercise equipment to its members.
This market comprises commercial users of fitness equipment like hotels, corporate wellness centers, hospitals, schools and residential buildings.

products_and_services.product_description: Customers use treadmills for walking, jogging or running, depending on the user's speed, intensity and resistance preferences.
Elliptical trainers are stationary exercise machines that simulate stair climbing, walking or running.
Exercise bikes are devices made with pedals, a saddle and some handlebars that function similarly to traditional bicycles, except the bikes are stationary.
Free weight equipment includes several kinds of strength training weights like weight plates, dumbbells, kettlebells and barbells.
Hydraulic equipment uses hydraulic oil-filled cylinders to provide bidirectional resistance in strength training movements, creating a push-pull effect and increasing muscle use.
Functional trainers are multifunctional machines, like hexagon rings and cable columns, usable for a complete body workout.
Other fitness equipment manufacturers produce include miscellaneous machine parts, exercise balls and stepping platforms, boxing bags, agility training equipment and accessories.

tier_1_suppliers: Rubber Product Manufacturing in the US
Iron & Steel Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Plastic Pipe & Parts Manufacturing in the US
Metal Pipe & Tube Manufacturing in the US
Metalworking Machinery Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Sporting Goods Stores in the US
Gym, Health & Fitness Clubs in the US
tier_2_buyers: Golf Courses & Country Clubs in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Popularity of Treadmills Has Crept Downward
demand_determinants.determinant_description: According to the International Health, Racquet & Sportsclub Association, the popularity of specialized classes and training systems is decreasing younger exercisers' use of treadmills.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Other Forms of Exercise Have Begun to Replace Ellipticals and Step Machines
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Younger exercisers increasingly use other exercise equipment, reducing consumers' attraction to ellipticals and step machines.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Exercise Bikes Have Increased in Popularity Following the Pandemic
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The pandemic increased the popularity of exercise bikes like the Peloton bike as spin classes at home became a common source of exercise amid gym closures.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Kettlebells Attracted Consumers to Free Weights
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The increase in individuals working out from home during the pandemic increased the demand for free weights.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Safety Benefits Drive Customers Toward Hydraulic Equipment
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This equipment has grown in popularity since it avoids the risk of injury from overexertion or improper use.
The versatility of functional trainers increased their popularity, particularly among home users amid gym closures.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Consumers increasingly purchased cheap imports in 2020 as lower consumer confidence and spending reduced their wiliness to buy more expensive domestically produced equipment.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Import Penetration is Increasing and Dominated by China and Taiwan
international_trade_points.trade_description: Imports have surged in recent years as cheap labor in China, and Taiwan enables manufacturers in these countries to charge less for their products.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports Plummet at the Outbreak of COVID-19
international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports fell by nearly one-quarter amid the outbreak of COVID-19 in 2020 as the pandemic led to tepid global demand.
Domestic manufacturers are concentrating on more technologically advanced equipment to differentiate themselves from lower-cost manufacturers in Asia.

business_locations.location_description: The large population in the Southeast leads to the high concentration of manufacturers.
California is a powerhouse in the West due to warmer weather increasing sports participation.
The cold climate of New England contributes to the small number of gym and exercise equipment manufacturers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Gym and exercise equipment manufacturers must abide by general industrial and manufacturing activities. Under the Clean Water Act and the Solid Waste Disposal Act, water and solid waste discharge procedures must be followed. The Clean Air Act establishes limits on air pollutants. The Cluster Rule reduces the number of toxins released into the water and air. The EPA monitors industrial machinery considered noise pollutants through a developed noise emission standard.
Cabinet and vanity manufacturers had to comply with social distancing guidelines. Some manufacturers had to halt production in early 2020.

factors_increased_barrier: Significant capital investment is needed in the manufacturing and the research and development processes, deterring potential new entrants from entering the space.
The top companies have established brand recognition and lucrative partnerships with health clubs and fitness centers to supply their exercise equipment.
Increased import penetration caused many smaller producers to shut down or move production overseas.

basis_points.basis_title: Price is the primary source of competition
basis_points.basis_description: Domestic producers face stiff competition from cheap imports.

basis_points.basis_title: Manufacturers compete based on their products' quality and features
basis_points.basis_description: Household names get established by providing quality products.

concentration_points.concentration_title: New entrants are discouraged by high start-up costs
concentration_points.concentration_description: Significant capital investment is needed in the manufacturing and the research and development processes, deterring potential new entrants from entering the space.
The top companies have established brand recognition and lucrative partnerships with health clubs and fitness centers to supply their exercise equipment.

Increased import penetration caused many smaller producers to shut down or move production overseas. As smaller companies exited the industry, top companies earned increasing market share despite minimal or negative revenue growth.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: OTHER COSTS RISE ALONGSIDE STIFF COMPETITION
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2023, other costs will comprise 27.4% of revenue. Other costs include insurance, research and development and general administrative expenses. Companies are increasing their research and development costs to differentiate themselves, incentivizing consumers to purchase their products over foreign-made products.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: RISING INPUT COSTS AND IMPORT PENETRATION CHALLENGE PROFIT
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2023, profit will comprise 7.8% of revenue. The fluctuating price of inputs, like steel and aluminum, has hindered profit growth. Competition from low-cost imports has also put pressure on profit. Gym and exercise equipment manufacturers have been selling directly to retailers and end-user consumers, cutting out the middleman and helping industry profit margins improve.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: IMPORT PENETRATION PUSHES DOMESTIC MANUFACTURERS TO REDUCE WAGE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages fell to account for 16.4% of revenue in 2023. Production automation increased in recent years as gym and exercise manufacturing companies seek to maintain advantages over foreign-produced, inexpensive competitor products. Many domestic manufacturers have relocated to take advantage of cheaper wages.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: While automation decreases the labor needed to manufacture gym and exercise equipment, skilled and knowledgeable designers must be retained and adequately compensated.

The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified. The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served my incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_description: An influx of imported gym and exercise equipment induced volatility for manufacturers. In 2020, the pandemic's economic uncertainty attracted home and individual consumers to cheaper imports. Imports increased 52.4% in 2020, leading to a contraction in industry revenue that same year.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Seasonality Has an Impact on Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Equipment sales are highest in the first and fourth quarters of the year, during the cooler months. Sales tend to be weaker during the second and third quarters, as consumers are more involved in outdoor exercise activities during the spring and summer.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The popularity of treadmills has crept downward
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Customers use treadmills for walking, jogging or running, depending on the user's speed, intensity and resistance preferences. According to the International Health, Racquet & Sportsclub Association, the popularity of specialized classes and training systems is decreasing younger exercisers' use of treadmills.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Other forms of exercise have begun to replace
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Elliptical trainers are stationary exercise machines that simulate stair climbing, walking or running. Younger exercisers increasingly use other exercise equipment, reducing consumers' attraction to ellipticals and step machines.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: EXERCISE BIKES HAVE INCREASED IN POPULARITY FOLLOWING
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Exercise bikes are devices made with pedals, a saddle and some handlebars that function similarly to traditional bicycles, except the bikes are stationary. The pandemic increased the popularity of exercise bikes like the Peloton bike as spin classes at home became a common source of exercise amid gym closures.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: KETTLEBELLS ATTRACTED CONSUMERS TO FREE WEIGHTS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Free weight equipment includes several kinds of strength training weights like weight plates, dumbbells, kettlebells and barbells. The increase in individuals working out from home during the pandemic increased the demand for free weights. Kettlebells' popularity surged alongside consumers working out from home as kettlebells take up minimal space and work for strength training and cardiovascular workouts.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: SAFETY BENEFITS DRIVE CUSTOMERS TOWARD HYDRAULIC EQUIPMENT
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Hydraulic equipment uses hydraulic oil-filled cylinders to provide bidirectional resistance in strength training movements, creating a push-pull effect and increasing muscle use. This equipment has grown in popularity since it avoids the risk of injury from overexertion or improper use.
Functional trainers are multifunctional machines, like hexagon rings and cable columns, usable for a complete body workout.

Other fitness equipment manufacturers produce include miscellaneous machine parts, exercise balls and stepping platforms, boxing bags, agility training equipment and accessories. This segment typically grows in line with the overall industry and has remained stable in recent years.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Industry imports have risen over the past five years; rising imports can be attributed to an influx of fitness equipment from manufacturers based in Asia, particularly in China and Taiwan. Imports have risen during the pandemic amid increasing demand for industry products from consumers seeking to exercise at home.

FAQs.question: How have imports from low-wage countries such as China and Taiwan impacted your operations?
FAQs.answer: Many industry players have relocated their manufacturing operations to countries with low-cost production expenditures; as a result, globalization has increased due to global manufacturers' access to low-cost labor, particularly in emerging economies such as China and Taiwan.

FAQs.question: Has your company located near key downstream distributors to reduce shipping costs?
FAQs.answer: In an effort to reduce their transportation costs, many industry manufacturers prefer to locate in areas that have high sales volumes; consequently, most industry manufacturers prefer to locate close to areas with high sports participation rates.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in research and development to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Research and development represents an important cost for fitness equipment manufacturers; product development, particularly the advent of new technologies, is crucial for industry operators to remain competitive.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology, such as computer-aided design, in your manufacturing operations?
FAQs.answer: Industry manufacturers are increasingly using computer-aided design to design new product innovations and modifications, boosting the efficiency of operations.

FAQs.question: Do you use RFID tracking systems to streamline all aspects of your company's manufacturing, sales, inventory and distribution channels?
FAQs.answer: RFID systems enable operators to streamline inventory and obtain detailed tracking information for a product's location; tracking industry products through the supply chain can be especially helpful for industry operators so they can track and manage product recalls more efficiently.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations, such as energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: Industry companies must comply with environmental laws and regulations that impose workplace standards and limitations on manufacturing emissions or be subject to potential fines and other penalties.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Gym and exercise equipment manufacturers receive assistance from a range of industry associations, including the Sports & Fitness Industry Association which conducts research, organizes trade shows, lobbies on the industry's behalf and promotes industry interests.

FAQs.question: How does your company's average profit margin compare with your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: The average industry profit margin for the Gym and Exercise Equipment Manufacturing industry has fluctuated over the past five years as a result of increased import penetration. Profit is anticipated to rise in 2021 due to heightened demand from the consumer market.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for the seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Demand for gym and exercise equipment is linked to seasonal trends, specifically weather conditions; equipment sales for manufacturers are typically highest in the first and fourth quarters of the year, during the cooler months.

FAQs.question: Do you manufacture any branded products? How do you promote your products and services?
FAQs.answer: Brand name and image are important aspects of this industry. Retailers are more likely to order goods that are attributed to brand names that are reliable.

FAQs.question: What factors affect demand and stock levels? What methods have you used during times when stock levels are low?
FAQs.answer: In an attempt to keep storage costs down, manufacturers need to be able to control the level of inventory on hand. Due to the spike in demand for home gym equipment during the pandemic, many manufacturers sold out of products such as kettlebells, delaying shipment times and resulting in an increase in production for many products.

FAQs.question: How quickly do you develop and adopt new technology? What are the associated costs?
FAQs.answer: Patented technology can be a competitive advantage when competing with imported products. Moreover, the rise of connectivity between technology and fitness devices has increased.

FAQs.question: How has demand for imports affected your overall revenue? How can you differentiate your products from similar equipment manufactured overseas?
FAQs.answer: An increase in import penetration into the manufacturing sector hurts domestic manufacturers of fitness equipment by lowering demand for their products. Imports are anticipated to rise during the pandemic, in line with increased demand for gym equipment from consumers during the coronavirus pandemic.

FAQs.question: How does a rise in the trade-weighted index affect your company? How do you mitigate this threat?
FAQs.answer: Imports satisfy a large portion of domestic demand for industry products. Therefore, the relative changes in the exchange rates significantly affect imports' competitiveness in the US market.

FAQs.question: How does a rise in disposable income levels affect demand for your company? How do you take advantage of rising disposable income levels?
FAQs.answer: Gym and exercise equipment are discretionary goods. As a result, as per capita disposable income rises, consumers can increasingly afford to purchase the industry's products for their personal use.
